word_mean: 弓：曲线形或弧形的结构。另见arcus
拱，主要承受轴向压力并由两端推力维持平衡的曲线或折线形构件。
用砖、石、混凝土或钢筋混凝土等建筑材料构筑的整体式弧形支架。

sentence.Network_en: Neither he nor his arch-rival, Giuseppe De Rita, won.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English : from Old French arche, based on Latin arcus 'bow'
mid 17th cent.: from arch-,by association with the sense 'rogue' in combinations such as arch-scoundrel

encyclopedia.content: 计量经济学模型 ARCH(Autoregressive conditional heteroskedasticity model)中文文献一般称作“自回归条件异方差模型” 计量经济学家恩格尔（Robert F.Engle），80年代开创性地提出了自回归条件异方差（AutoRegressive Conditional Heteroscedasticity）模型， 并成功地应用于英国通货膨胀指数的波动性研究。 (1982) ARCH模型能模拟时间序列变量的波动性的变化，它在计量金融领域中应用较为广泛。 很多学者从不同角度推广了ARCH

entry.def: An arch is a structure that is curved at the top and is supported on either side by a pillar, post, or wall.
An arch is a curved line or movement.
The arch of your foot is the curved section at the bottom in the middle.
If you arch a part of your body such as your back or if it arches, you bend it so that it forms a curve.

example.ex: Don't arch your back, keep your spine straight.

entry.tran: （表示惊奇或不赞同）扬起（眉毛）
entry.def: If you arch your eyebrows or if they arch, you move them upwards as a way of showing surprise or disapproval.

example.ex: 'Oh really?' he said, arching an eyebrow.
example.tran: “哦，真的吗？”他扬起一边的眉毛说。

entry.tran: 拱起；成弓形；呈弧形运动
entry.def: If something arches in a particular direction, it makes a curved line or movement.

example.ex: I gazed up at the domed ceiling arching overhead.
example.tran: 我抬头凝望着上方弧形的穹顶。

entry.def: An arch look is mysterious and mischievous.

example.ex: Both of them looked at him with that curious, slightly amused and even arch expression.
example.tran: 他们俩都看着他，带着一副好奇的、有点觉得好笑甚至是淘气的表情。

entry.def: If you say that someone is arch, you are criticizing them for talking or behaving as if they are better or more important than other people.

example.ex: Their attempts to be casual have so far just looked arch or patronising.
example.tran: 他们本想做出漫不经心的样子，结果反而显得傲慢自大或自视甚高。

means.word_mean: 1. a curved shape in the vertical plane that spans an opening
2. a curved bony structure supporting or enclosing organs (especially arches of the feet)
4. (architecture) a masonry construction (usually curved) for spanning an opening and supporting the weight above it
1. (of persons) highest in rank or authority or office;
2. (used of behavior or attitude) characteristic of those who treat others with condescension

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. =bow,表示"弓"; 2. =ruler/rule/chief, 表示"统治者,统治,主要的"

stems_affixes.value_cn: [运动或战争中的]弓箭手,射手
stems_affixes.word_buile: arch弓+er人→n.[运动或战争中的]弓箭手,射手
an无+arch统治者,统治,主要的+ism主义→n.无政府主义
arch统治者,统治,主要的+ive物,表示东西+s复数→统治的东西→统治者的文件→档案
matri母[女性]+arch首脑→n.女族长;女家长
mon=mono单个+arch统治者→一个统治者
patri父亲+arch统治者,统治,主要的→父亲统治→家长

sentences.en: Arches are built of wood, stone, brick or any other building material.
sentences.cn: 拱门是用木料、石块、砖头或其他建筑材料建成的。
树木在头顶上弯成拱形。

sentences.en: The cat arched her back when she saw the dog.
sentences.cn: 猫看见那只狗时拱起了背。
